title: How to Whistle Using an Acorn Cap

steps.title: Find an acorn cap.
steps.content: Find an acorn cap. This is the brown part on top of the acorn. Make sure it is not cracked or deformed. Also the larger the acorn cap the lower the pitch. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Grab the acorn cap in both of your hands between your thumb and index finger with the inside of the cap facing you.
steps.content: Grab the acorn cap in both of your hands between your thumb and index finger with the inside of the cap facing you. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Put your thumbs up to near the top of the acorn.
steps.content: Put your thumbs up to near the top of the acorn. The sides of the knuckles of your thumbs should be touching each other.

steps.title: Position the acorn so that a triangle of it is showing out between the tops of your thumb-knuckles.
steps.content: Position the acorn so that a triangle of it is showing out between the tops of your thumb-knuckles. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Put your upper lip on the top of your thumb-knuckles.
steps.content: Put your upper lip on the top of your thumb-knuckles. Then position your lips so that when you blow that no air will escape out of your bottom lip. This is the hard part, so you'll need to keep practicing. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Blow through your top lip right into the triangle that you had formed earlier.
steps.content: Blow through your top lip right into the triangle that you had formed earlier. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Congratulations!
steps.content: Congratulations! You've just learned how to acorn whistle. To change notes move your tongue up and down, think "eee" for high notes and "ooo" for low notes To change octaves simply shrink or enlarge the triangle.
